ai-thag16.10:1.1_0: This thought came to the ascetic
ai-thag16.10:1.2_0: in the forest full of flowers,
ai-thag16.10:2.3_0: from when the protector of the world,
ai-thag16.10:2.4_0: the best of men, was still here.
ai-thag16.10:3.1_0: Their robes were only for covering the private parts,
ai-thag16.10:3.4_0: content with whatever they were offered.
ai-thag16.10:5.2_0: Then, towards the time of medicine,
ai-thag16.10:5.3_0: such as tonics and other necessities,
ai-thag16.10:5.4_0: as they were for the ending of defilements.
ai-thag16.10:6.1_0: In the wilderness, at a tree’s root,
ai-thag16.10:6.4_0: they lived with that as their final goal.
ai-thag16.10:7.1_0: They were used to simple things, unburdensome,
ai-thag16.10:7.4_0: their thoughts were intent on the goal.
ai-thag16.10:8.2_0: in their movements, eating, and practice;
ai-thag16.10:9.1_0: With the utter ending of all defilements,
ai-thag16.10:9.2_0: those senior monks have now been quenched.
ai-thag16.10:9.3_0: They were great meditators and great benefactors—
ai-thag16.10:9.4_0: there are few like them today.

ai-thag16.10:11.3_0: Those who are ready for seclusion
ai-thag16.10:11.4_0: are all that’s left of the true Dhamma.
ai-thag16.10:12.3_0: they play with fools, it seems to me,
ai-thag16.10:13.4_0: as if they had declared war on themselves.
ai-thag16.10:15.4_0: independent of others and the next,
ai-thag16.10:16.1_0: They eat until their bellies are full,
ai-thag16.10:16.2_0: and then they lie to sleep on their backs.
ai-thag16.10:16.3_0: When they wake up, they keep on chatting,
ai-thag16.10:17.1_0: Valuing all the arts and crafts,
ai-thag16.10:17.4_0: ‘This is the goal of the ascetic life.’
ai-thag16.10:20.1_0: In medicine they are like doctors,
ai-thag16.10:22.3_0: those who live for a livelihood
ai-thag16.10:23.3_0: They teach the Dhamma to others
ai-thag16.10:24.3_0: They’re shameless, and do not care
ai-thag16.10:24.4_0: that they live on someone else’s property.
ai-thag16.10:25.1_0: Some with shaven head and robe
ai-thag16.10:25.2_0: my head is shaven, I wear the outer robe.
ai-thag16.10:25.3_0: but wish only to be honored,
ai-thag16.10:26.1_0: When things have come to this,
ai-thag16.10:26.3_0: to realize what has not yet been realized,
ai-thag16.10:26.4_0: to realize what is suitable and fearful,
ai-thag16.10:27.1_0: When shoeless on a thorny path,
ai-thag16.10:27.4_0: that’s how a sage should walk in the village.

ai-thag16.10:29.1_0: That is what the ascetic, whose faculties
ai-thag16.10:29.2_0: were fully developed, said in the sāl tree grove.
ai-thag16.10:29.3_0: The brahmin, the hermit, became quenched,
ai-thag16.10:29.4_0: they’ve come to an end, and be reborn.”
ai-thag16.10:29.7_0: The Book of the Twenties is finished.
